indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1)Number of persons living with HIV/AIDS receiving antiretroviral treatment 2)Number of episodes of OIs treated among people ( adult) on ART (2012) 3)% of health facilities dispensing ARVs which have experienced a stock-out of at least one required ARV in the last 12 months 4)Number of HIV - positive pregnant women who received ARVs to reduce the risk of mother to child transmission 5)Number of Provinces supervised ( only 2013 and 2014) 6)Number of people trained in M&E and data collection tools ( only 2013 and 2014)

baseline.comment: 1) 2000 PLWHA receiving ARV treatment (adults and children) 2) 100 HIV+ Pregnant women receiving Prophylaxis and treatment 3) 5Labs. established 4) 10 VCTs established 5) 22,000 people counselled and tested on HIV/AIDS 6)4 health centres providing PMTCT services according to national guidelines

actual.comment: 1) 67,181 (Global fund support 23.151 people on ART) 3) 0 % 4) 5,301 5) 14 6) 231

location.name: Angola
location.activity-description: Assist the national civil protection system in enhancing disaster and risk management capacity.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1) Number of Civil Protection Commission members trained in contingency planning and disaster response at national and local levels. 2) Number of drought hazard preparedness and mitigation plans in place in the southern region. 3) Strategic planning framework established in advancing Disaster Risk Management agenda in the country including preparation of next cycle (2015-2019). 4) A resource mobilization tool annually developed by the mine action authority - CNIDAH. 5) Article 7 Transparency report submitted by the CNIDAH annually under the Anti-Personnel Mine Ban Convention.

baseline.comment: 1) 0 [2009] 2) 0 [2009] 3) Needs to update and renew strategic planning framework at the national level in advancing Disaster Risk Management agenda. 4) The national mine action programme requires continued support from the Mine Action Support Group. 5) Angola is required to annually report to the UN on the implementation of the Mine Ban Convention as a state party.

target.comment: 1) 500 2) 3 3) The Strategic Plan on Disaster Risk Management (DRM) 2015-2017 developed and preparation of next cycle (2015-2017) made. 4) The Portfolio of Mine Action Projects 2015 prepared. 5) Article 7 Transparency report and Work plan 2014-2017 presented.

actual.comment: 1) 548 2) 6 3) National Disaster Risk Management Plan 2015-2017 was drafted, and DRR programming 2015-2017 was completed for approval. 4) The Portfolio of Mine Action Projects 2015 was prepared by CNIDAH. 5) Article 7 Transparency report 2014 and Work plan 2014-2017 was presented by Angola at the 3rd Review Conference of the Anti-Personnel Mine Ban Convention, Maputo in June.

target.comment: This project has been financially closed.

actual.comment: This project has been financially closed.

result.title: Objective
result.description: Objective: Catalyze an improvement in the overall management of the protected areas network, through rehabilitating Iona National Park

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1. Financial sustainability scorecard for national system of protected areas

actual.comment: Progress made towards the target. 5% Government has invested USD6M in Iona Park infrastructure, rehabilitated the training school at Quicama National Park, the entry gate, herbarium and conference room.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 2. Capacity development indicator score for protected area system

actual.comment: Progress made towards the target. Systemic 46% - establishment of CBD for policy and strategic oversight over PAs Institutional 40% - INBAC fully functional and responsible for implementation of PAs management support programmes in addition a training school was rehabilitated in Kuando Kubango for development of rangers and Park Administrators. Park Administrators participated at the World Parks Congress to share and learn lessons for improved capacities. Individual 37%- 20 park rangers and 17 staff were trained on security and use of GIS, 2 Managers trained on GEF procedures.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 3. Total government budget allocation (including operational, HR and capital budget) (US$ per annum) for protected area management

actual.comment: Target achieved and surpassed by far. Government has allocated $82M for PAs in 2015 budget. Giving the target level of $8M the result is over 100%.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: 4. Number of protected areas in which the METT is adopted as a tool to monitor effectiveness of PA management

actual.comment: The methodology of METT has been adopted for all 7 PAs. However only Iona Park has started using the tool for data collection. Other parks are expected to come on stream in the near future.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Outcome 1) Rehabilitation of Iona National Park

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
5. Management Effectiveness Tracking Tool scorecard:
Iona National Park

target.comment: 5 points out of 102 possible, giving (Jan 2012) = 5%. [NOTE ON LOGFRAME 2014:]We need to make a correction to the baseline. In the PRODOC, it mentions a 7% rate. However, 5 points was the final baseline score, and all questions were considered (none considered n/a). This gives a total possible points of 102 and a percentage of 5% at the baseline.

actual.comment: Target achieved, but this needs to be independently vetted. Considerable improvement in the METT score has been attained since the original evaluation of November 20, 2011. The June 2015 METT evaluation returned a score of 32/102 = 31% in comparison with only 5/102 = 5% in 2011. In the 2011 assessment only three questions (1, 5 & 6) were awarded positive scores totaling 5 of a possible 9 points. The same total score for these three questions was also awarded in 2015. However, of the 39 questions that received zero scores in 2011, 23 received positive scores in the recent evaluation indicating a wide-ranging improvement in management effectiveness. The target of at least 45% in the final evaluation is considered attainable.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 6. Number of park management staff appointed, equipped, trained and deployed in the park

actual.comment: Approaching target. Same as last year.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 7. Percentage (%) of park visitors obtaining a permit to traverse/overnight in the park

actual.comment: Progress made towards the target. 40% of Park visitors is reported. Registration and entry fees collection pilot system launch in October 2014, has been reformulated and submitted to the local government authority for approval.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: 8. Proportion (%) of the plains grassland habitats of the park (~600km2) overgrazed by livestock (goats and cattle)

actual.comment: Not possible to assess the indicator with accuracy, but there are good indications that the baseline may have been optimistic and the target even more so. The aerial survey is yet to be conducted. Observations from the ground indicate an increase of at least 40% of the grassland habitats of the park overgrazed by livestock.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: 9. Increase in wildlife populations: Oryx Hartmann's Zebra Springbok Ostrich

target.comment:
9a) At least 2000
9b) At least 300
9c) At least 3500
9d) At least 500

actual.comment:
Progress made towards the general target. Road count reports increase in wildlife populations as follows:
9b) Oryx: 1815 = 10% increase, but still below target
9b) Hartmann's zebra: 270 = 1% increase, meaning no change, given data uncertainty, meaning basically status quo vis-a-vis baseline
9c) Springbok: 3120 = 30% increase and approaching the target
9d) Ostrich: 420 = 5% increase, but still below target

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: 10. Number of critical natural freshwater springs and wells secured and accessible for use by medium-sized and large wildlife species

actual.comment: Not possible to inform indicator. The hydrological study and the park management plan are in progress.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: 11. Number of poaching incidents (park visitors) recorded in the park/annum

actual.comment: Target achieve. Less than 12. Shots were heard in Mupaca area located at east of Iona and further east towards Helola and Montenegro areas. Motorcycles are used to hunt wild animals within the Park in the south of Espinheira.

indicator.title: Indicator 8
indicator.description: 12. Proportion (%) of communities living in the park that are adequately represented in the park management decision-making processes.

actual.comment: No change. 0% of communities living in the park are represented the park management decision-making processes. Community study and park management planning initiated but are not yet at the stage of informing the project on this indicator.

indicator.title: Indicator 9
indicator.description: 13. Number of job opportunities (direct and indirect) created for local communities living in, or adjacent to, the park

target.comment:
a) Direct: at least 10
b) Indirect: at least 30

actual.comment: Target partially achieved. a) Direct: 12 members of community are community agents (rangers) b) Indirect: 0

indicator.title: Indicator 10
indicator.description: 14. Average annual income (US$) of households living in the park

actual.comment: Not possible to inform indicator at this stage. The study on Community Profile is on going and data on income levels will be ready at finalization of the exercise.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Outcome 2) Strengthen institutional capacity to manage the protected areas network

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 15. Strategic Plan, and a policy framework, for the system of protected areas formally approved by government

actual.comment: Yes.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 16. Organizational structure for protected areas and job descriptions, remuneration levels and conditions of service for protected area staff formally adopted by government

actual.comment: Not possible to inform indicator at this stage. The Park Management Plan study is on going which will frame the organizational structure of the Park.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 17. Recruitment of staff to approved protected area posts in the organogram of the protected area agency (as a % of posts with permanent staff appointed)

actual.comment: Target fully achieved. Current level remains as reported in 2014.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: 18. Number of protected area staff completing in-service training and skills development programmes

actual.comment: Target fully achieved. Further to the basic trainings conducted last year, 17 government staff of INBAC and Park Administrators of Mavinga, Luengue-Luiana, Chimalavera and Cangandala, were trained in GIS.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: 19. Number of senior protected area staff in a structured mentoring programme

actual.comment: Target partially achieved. 1 senior staff, the Iona Park Administrator continue to be mentored by the International Park Manager.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: 20. Number of national parks and strict nature reserves with fully documented up-to-date assessments of their state and biodiversity value

actual.comment: Initiated.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: 21. Number of protected areas where a structured rationalisation and rehabilitation programme is adequately resourced and under implementation

actual.comment: 1. Currently, only the Iona Park rehabilitation programme is under implementation. Target partially Achieved.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1) Number of technician trained on M&E, data collection tools and stock management. 2) Number of GTNM&E meetings. 3) Number of health facility with SIS installed and operational. 4) Number of Provinces supervised regarding the use of thermometers, pharmacovigilance. 5) National formulary validated. (Note: The project started in 2015).

baseline.comment: 1) 338 technicians has been trained on M&E, data collection tools and stock management. 2) The national M&E group (GTNM&E) has been reactivated and TORs of the GTNM&E approved. 3) Software SIS installed at Province level. 4) Installation of thermometers in all the Provincials warehouse and health facilities. 5) List of essentials medicines validated and starting the elaboration of the National Formulary.

actual.comment: Note: The project started in 2015

1) 80; 46 in M&E issue, 19 in health system information and 15 in data collection 2) 1 3) 5 Municipality health facility 4) 8 5) The draft of the national formulary of essential medicines is read but needs to be revised by the specialist before the final validation
